class.name: Barbaari
flavor: Raivo consumes you in battle. You delight in wreaking havoc and using powerful weapons to carve through your enemies, relying on astonishing durability without needing complicated techniques or rigid training. Your rages draw upon a vicious Vaisto, which you might associate with an Eläin, a Henki, or some part of yourself. To many barbarians, brute force is a hammer and every problem looks like a nail, whereas others try to hold back the storm of emotions inside them and release their Raivo only when it matters most.

fluff.name: During Combat Encounters...
entries: You summon your Raivo and rush to the front lines to smash your way through. Offense is your best defense—you'll need to drop foes before they can exploit your relatively low defenses.

fluff.name: During social encounters...
entries: You use intimidation to get what you need, especially when gentler persuasion can't get the job done.

fluff.name: While exploring...
entries: You look out for danger, ready to rush headfirst into battle in an instant. You climb the challenging rock wall and drop a rope for others to follow, and you wade into the risky currents to reach the hidden switch beneath the water's surface. If something needs breaking, you're up to the task!

fluff.name: In downtime...
entries: You might head to a tavern to carouse, build up the fearsome legend of your mighty deeds, or recruit followers to become a warlord in your own right.

items: Have a deep-seated well of anger, hatred, or frustration.
Prefer a straightforward approach to one requiring patience and tedium.
Engage in a regimen of intense physical fitness—and punch anyone who says this conflicts with your distaste for patience and tedium.
Rely on your courage and your strength, and trust that you can hold your own in a fight.
See you as uncivilized or a boorish lout unfit for high society.
Believe that you are loyal to your friends and allies and will never relent until the fight is done.

summary.text: The Barbaari flies into a Raivo on the battlefield, smashing foes with abandon.

classFeature.name: Ancestry and Background
entries: In addition to the abilities provided by your class at 1st level, you have the benefits of your selected ancestry and background, as described in Chapter 2.

classFeature.name: Initial Proficiencies
entries: At 1st level, you gain a number of proficiencies that represent your basic training. These proficiencies are noted at the start of this class.

classFeature.name: Raivo
entries: You gain the {@action Raivo} action, which lets you fly into a frenzy.

classFeature.name: Vaisto
entries: Your Raivo wells up from a dominant Vaisto—one you learned from a tradition or that comes naturally to you. Your Vaisto gives you an ability, requires you to avoid certain behaviors, grants you increased damage and resistances at higher levels, and allows you to select feats tied to your Vaisto.

classFeature.name: Barbaari Feats
entries: At 1st level and every even-numbered level thereafter, you gain an {@filter Barbaari class feat|feats||type=class|Class=Barbaari|level=[1;1]}.

classFeature.name: Skill Feats
entries: At 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain a {@filter skill feat|feats||type=skill;!archetype}. Skill feats can be found in Chapter 5 and have the {@trait skill} trait. You must be trained or better in the corresponding skill to select a skill feat.

classFeature.name: Deny Advantage
entries: Your foes struggle to pass your defenses. You aren't {@condition flat-footed} to {@condition hidden}, {@condition undetected}, or flanking creatures of your level or lower, or creatures of your level or lower using surprise attack. However, they can still help their allies flank.

classFeature.name: General Feats
entries: At 3rd level and every 4 levels thereafter, you gain a {@filter general feat|feats||type=general|level=[1;3]}.

classFeature.name: Skill Increases
entries: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain a skill increase. You can use this increase either to increase your proficiency rank to trained in one skill you're untrained in, or to increase your proficiency rank in one skill in which you're already trained to expert.

At 7th level, you can use skill increases to increase your proficiency rank to master in a skill in which you're already an expert, and at 15th level, you can use them to increase your proficiency rank to legendary in a skill in which you're already a master.

classFeature.name: Ability Boosts
entries: At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter, you boost four different ability scores. You can use these ability boosts to increase your ability scores above 18. Boosting an ability score increases it by 1 if it's already 18 or above, or by 2 if it starts out below 18.

classFeature.name: Ancestry Feats
entries: In addition to the ancestry feat you started with, you gain an {@filter ancestry feat|feats||type=ancestry} at 5th level and every 4 levels thereafter. The list of ancestry feats available to you can be found in your ancestry's entry in Chapter 2.

classFeature.name: Brutality
entries: Your Kiihko makes your weapons lethal. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to expert. While raging, you gain access to the critical specialization effects for melee weapons and unarmed attacks.

classFeature.name: Juggernaut
entries: Your body is accustomed to physical hardship and resistant to ailments. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

classFeature.name: Weapon Specialization
entries: Your Raivo helps you hit harder. You deal an additional 2 damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you have expert proficiency. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary. You gain your Vaisto's specialization ability.

classFeature.name: Lightning Reflexes
entries: Your reflexes are lightning fast. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

classFeature.name: Raging Resistance
entries: Repeated exposure and toughened skin allow you to fend off harm. While raging, you gain resistance equal to 3 + your Constitution modifier to damage types based on your Vaisto.

classFeature.name: Mighty Raivo
entries: Your Raivo intensifies and lets you burst into action. Your proficiency rank for your Barbaari class DC increases to expert. You gain the {@action Mighty Raivo} free action.

classFeature.name: Greater Juggernaut
entries: You have a stalwart physiology. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on a Fortitude save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on a Fortitude save against an effect that deals damage, you halve the damage you take.

classFeature.name: Medium Armor Expertise
entries: You've learned to defend yourself better against attacks. Your proficiency ranks for light armor, medium armor, and unarmored defense increase to expert.

classFeature.name: Weapon Kiihko
entries: Your Raivo makes you even more effective with the weapons you wield. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to master.

classFeature.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
entries: The weapons you've mastered become truly fearsome in your hands. Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert, 6 if you're a master, and 8 if you're legendary. You gain a greater benefit from your Vaisto's specialization ability.

classFeature.name: Indomitable Will
entries: Your Raivo makes it difficult to control you. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

classFeature.name: Heightened Senses
entries: Your Vaisto heightens each of your senses further. Your proficiency rank for {@skill Perception} increases to master

classFeature.name: Quick Raivo
entries: You recover from your {@action Raivo} quickly, and are soon ready to begin anew. After you spend a full turn without raging, you can {@action Raivo} again without needing to wait 1 minute.

classFeature.name: Armor of Kiihko
entries: Your training and Raivo deepen your connection to your armor. Your proficiency ranks for light armor, medium armor, and unarmored defense increase to master.

classFeature.name: Devastator
entries: Your {@action Strike||Strikes} are so devastating that you hardly care about resistance, and your Barbaari abilities are unparalleled. Your proficiency rank for your Barbaari class DC increases to master. Your melee {@action Strike||Strikes} ignore 10 points of a creature's resistance to their physical damage.

entries.name: Eläin Vaisto
entries: The Kiihko of a wild predator fills you when you {@action Raivo}, granting you ferocious unarmed attacks. Cultures that revere vicious animals (such as apes or bears) give rise to barbarians with this Vaisto. You might also be at war with an uncontrollable, animalistic side of your personality, or you might be a descendant of a werewolf or another werecreature. Select an Eläin from {@table Eläin Instincts|CRB|Table 3–3: Eläin Instincts} that best matches your chosen Eläin.

entries.name: Anathema
entries: Flagrantly disrespecting an Eläin of your chosen kind is anathema to your Vaisto, as is using weapons while raging.

entries.name: Bestial Raivo (Vaisto Ability)
entries: When you {@action Raivo}, you gain your chosen Eläin's unarmed attack (or attacks). The specific attack gained, the damage it deals, and its traits are listed on {@table Eläin Instincts|CRB|Table 3–3: Eläin Instincts}. These attacks are in the {@group brawling} group. Your {@action Raivo} action gains the {@trait morph}, {@trait primal}, and {@trait transmutation} traits.

entries.name: Specialization Ability
entries: Increase the damage die size for the unarmed attacks granted by your chosen Eläin by one step, and increase the additional damage from {@action Raivo} from 2 to 5 for your chosen Eläin's unarmed attacks. The frog's tongue attack and deer's antler attack gain {@trait reach} 10 feet. If you have greater weapon specialization, increase the damage from {@action Raivo} from 5 to 12 for your chosen Eläin's unarmed attacks.

entries.name: Raging Resistance
entries: You resist piercing and slashing damage.

entries.name: Lohikäärme Vaisto
entries: You summon the Kiihko of a mighty Lohikäärme and manifest incredible abilities. Perhaps your culture reveres draconic majesty, or you gained your connection by drinking or bathing in Lohikäärme's blood or after watching a marauding wyrm burn your village. Select a type of Lohikäärme from {@table Lohikäärme Instincts|CRB|Table 3–4: Lohikäärme Instincts} to be your Vaisto's Lohikäärme type. Chromatic dragons tend to be evil, and metallic dragons tend to be good.

entries.name: Anathema
entries: Letting a personal insult against you slide is anathema to your Vaisto. Choose whether your character respects or abhors your Lohikäärme type. If you respect it, defying such a Lohikäärme is anathema, and if you abhor it, failing to defeat such a Lohikäärme you come across is anathema.

entries.name: Draconic Raivo (Vaisto Ability)
entries: While raging, you can increase the additional damage from {@action Raivo} from 2 to 4 and change its damage type to match that of your Lohikäärme's breath weapon instead of the damage type for your weapon or unarmed attack. If you do this, your {@action Raivo} action gains the {@trait arcane} and {@trait evocation} traits, as well as the trait matching the damage type.

entries.name: Specialization Ability
entries: When you use draconic Raivo, you increase the additional damage from {@action Raivo} from 4 to 8. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the damage from {@action Raivo} when using draconic Raivo from 8 to 16.

entries.name: Raging Resistance
entries: You resist piercing damage and the damage type of your Lohikäärme's breath weapon.

entries.name: Luonnonvoima Vaisto
entries: This Vaisto option for barbarians allows you to channel Luonnonvoima forces, bonding with a single element and its associated plane. Perhaps your ancestors were Luonnonvoima conjurers or blessed by an Luonnonvoima lord. Select an element from the {@table Luonnonvoima Instincts|RoE|Luonnonvoima Instincts} table to be your Vaisto's element. If your element offers multiple damage types, choose one of those type when you select your element.

entries.name: Anathema
entries: Disrespecting an Luonnonvoima creature is anathema to your Vaisto; defending yourself against one is not. Purposefully despoiling the Luonnonvoima plane associated with your element is anathema to your Vaisto, though this doesn't prevent you from responsibly altering that plane.

entries.name: Luonnonvoima Raivo (Vaisto Ability)
entries: While raging, you're cloaked in a vortex of Luonnonvoima matter; you become {@condition concealed} against ranged attacks. You can't use this concealment to {@action Hide} or {@action Sneak}. While raging, you increase the additional damage from {@action Raivo} from 2 to 4 and change its damage type to the one you selected for your element.

If you have any {@class Kineticist|RoE} {@trait Impulse} with the same element type as the one you chose for your Vaisto, such as ones gained by taking the {@feat Kineticist Dedication|RoE} multiclass feat, they gain the {@trait Raivo} trait.

entries.name: Specialization Ability
entries: When you use Luonnonvoima Raivo, you increase the damage from {@action Raivo} from 4 to 6. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the damage from {@action Raivo} when using Luonnonvoima Raivo from 6 to 12.

entries.name: Raging Resistance
entries: You resist the damage dealt by attacks and abilities of Luonnonvoima creatures of your chosen element, as well as creatures made of your element, regardless of the damage type. You also resist damage dealt by attacks, spells, and abilities with your Luonnonvoima trait.

entries.name: Kiihko Vaisto
entries: Your Raivo comes from a deep and purely personal well within you. You use your Raivo as you choose.

entries.name: Anathema and Vaisto Ability
entries: You don't have an anathema or an Vaisto ability. Instead, you gain an additional {@filter 1st-level Barbaari feat|feats||Class=Barbaari|level=[1;1]|type=class}.

entries.name: Specialization Ability
entries: Increase the additional damage from {@action Raivo} from 2 to 6. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the additional damage from {@action Raivo} to 12.

entries.name: Raging Resistance
entries: You resist physical weapon damage, but not physical damage from other sources (such as unarmed attacks).

entries.name: Jätti Vaisto
entries: Your Raivo gives you the raw power and size of a Jätti. This doesn't necessarily mean you revere giants—you might scoff at them or even aspire to slay them! You could instead seem like a Jätti to other people due to your exceptional strength or larger-than-life emotions and ego.

entries.name: Anathema
entries: Failing to face a personal challenge of strength is anathema.

entries.name: Titan Mauler (Vaisto Ability)
entries: You can use a weapon built for a Large creature if you are Small or Medium (both normally and when raging). If you're not Small or Medium, you can use a weapon built for a creature one size larger than you. You gain access to this larger weapon, which can be of any weapon type otherwise available at character creation. It has the normal Price and Bulk for a weapon of its size. When wielding such a weapon in combat, increase your additional damage from {@action Raivo} from 2 to 6, but you have the {@condition clumsy 1} condition because of the weapon's unwieldy size. You can't remove this {@condition clumsy} condition or ignore its penalties by any means while wielding the weapon.

entries.name: Specialization Ability
entries: Increase the damage from {@action Raivo} when using a larger weapon from 6 to 10; if you have greater weapon specialization, increase it from 10 to 18.

entries.name: Raging Resistance
entries: You resist bludgeoning damage and your choice of cold, electricity, or fire, chosen when you gain raging resistance.

entries.name: Henki Vaisto
entries: Whether you are emotionally sensitive to the spirits around you; worship ancestors or apparitions; or are haunted by the specter of an ancestor, relative, friend, or foe, your Raivo takes the form of a spiritual possession.

entries.name: Anathema
entries: Disrespecting corpses or spirits is anathema to your Vaisto; defending yourself against undead creatures is not.

entries.name: Henki Raivo (Vaisto Ability)
entries: While raging, you can increase the additional damage from {@action Raivo} from 2 to 3 and change its damage type to negative or positive, instead of the damage type for your weapon or unarmed attack (choose each time you Raivo). If you choose to deal negative or positive damage, your weapon or unarmed attack gains the effects of the {@item ghost touch} property rune, which makes it more effective against incorporeal creatures, and your {@action Raivo} action gains the divine and necromancy traits, plus negative or positive, as appropriate.

entries.name: Specialization Ability
entries: When using Henki Raivo, increase the damage from {@action Raivo} from 3 to 7. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the damage when using Henki Raivo to 13.

entries.name: Raging Resistance
entries: You resist negative damage, as well as damage dealt by the attacks and abilities of undead creatures, regardless of the damage type.

entries.name: Taikausko Vaisto
entries: A deep distrust of magic drives you to forgo and counter the metaphysical nonsense of spellcasters. Whether you're a member of a superstitious family or culture that distrusts magic, a warrior in constant battle against wizards and witches, a survivor of a magical accident that instilled an intense aversion in your mind and body, or a scion of a bloodline known for its magic resistance, your Raivo is inimical to magic. This makes you an excellent mage hunter but slow to trust practitioners of magical arts. Your extremely restrictive anathema grants you powers beyond those of other instincts.

entries.name: Anathema
entries: Willingly accepting the effects of magic spells (including from scrolls, wands, and the like), even from your allies, is anathema to your Vaisto. You can still drink potions and invest and activate most magic items you find, though items that cast spells are subject to the same restrictions as all other spells. If an ally insists on using magic on you despite your unwillingness, and you have no reason to believe they will stop, continuing to travel with that ally of your own free will counts as willingly accepting their spells (as do similar circumstances) and thus is also anathema to your Vaisto.

entries.name: Superstitious Resilience (Vaisto Ability)
entries: While raging, you gain a +2 status bonus to all saves against magic. Increase your damage from {@action Raivo} from 2 to 4 against creatures that can cast spells. Once every 10 minutes, when you {@action Raivo}, you regain Hit Points equal to the temporary Hit Points you gain from that {@action Raivo} action.

entries.name: Specialization Ability
entries: Increase the damage from {@action Raivo} from 4 to 8 against creatures that can cast spells. If you have greater raging specialization, instead increase the damage from {@action Raivo} to 12 against creatures with spells and 8 against other creatures.

entries.name: Raging Resistance
entries: Choose two associated magical traditions: {@trait arcane} and {@trait occult}, {@trait arcane} and {@trait primal}, {@trait divine} and {@trait occult}, or {@trait divine} and {@trait primal}. The resistance from your raging resistance class feature applies against all damage you take from spells cast with these two traditions of magic, regardless of the type of damage dealt by the spell.
